title: DOM Manipulation Quiz
description: Assess your understanding of DOM manipulation, element selection, and event handling.

questions.question: Which method selects ALL elements matching a CSS selector?
questions.explanation: querySelectorAll() returns a NodeList containing all elements that match the specified CSS selector.

questions.question: innerHTML is always safer to use than textContent.
questions.explanation: textContent is safer than innerHTML because it doesn't parse HTML, preventing potential XSS (Cross-Site Scripting) attacks.

questions.question: Which method adds a CSS class to an element?
questions.explanation: The classList.add() method is used to add one or more CSS classes to an element.

questions.question: What is event delegation?
options: Adding events to parent elements to handle child events
questions.correctAnswer: Adding events to parent elements to handle child events
questions.explanation: Event delegation is a technique where you add an event listener to a parent element to handle events from its children, leveraging event bubbling.

questions.question: document.createElement() automatically adds the element to the DOM.
questions.explanation: document.createElement() only creates the element in memory. You must explicitly add it to the DOM using methods like appendChild() or append().
